data.persona: I ride in boats to catch fish. I catch fish in the ocean. I usually get a boat full of fish.
data.description:
You are in the pier walkway.
On the seashore facing the pier, seagulls squawk as they swirl overhead. The smell of salt fills the air, and the gentle, dull roar of the waves lapping the beach is omnipresent. A gentle breeze blows, and the chatter of the villagers fishing drifts down to the shoreline from the pier.
There's some water that is as clear as a crystal here.
A water scientist is here.

You are carrying a broken fishing pole, a weight, and a pouch, wearing a polishing cloth, a white cloth, a shirt, a ceremonial hat, and some boots, and wielding a knife.

data.short_motivation: I head home after a long day of fishing.
data.mid_motivation: I repair my broken fishing pole.
data.long_motivation: I ask the scientist how much mercury is in the water to determine if it is healthy to eat my fish.

timeline.label: 30 minutes ago
timeline.action: drop my line in the water.

timeline.label: 5 minutes ago
timeline.action: wield pouch to get a water sample.

timeline.label: 15 minutes from now
timeline.action: put fishing gear in grass to dry out.

timeline.label: 1 hour from now
timeline.action: put super glue in fishing pole.
